jparsec.math

Class Regression

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.math.Regression

  • public class Regression
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for fitting data to a Gaussian function, a polynomial (Nelder and Mead Simplex method), or simple/multiple linear regression.

    See Michael Thomas Flanagan's Java library on-line web page:
    http://www.ee.ucl.ac.uk/~mflanaga/java/Regression.html
    http://www.ee.ucl.ac.uk/~mflanaga/java/

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    M. Thomas Flanagan, T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain), just code cleanup

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Regression(double[][] xData, double[] yData)
      Constructor with data with x as 2D array and no weights provided (set to 1).
      Regression(double[][] xData, double[] yData, double[] weight)
      Constructor with data with x as 2D array and weights provided.
      Regression(double[] xxData, double[] yData)
      Constructor with data with x as 1D array and no weights (they are set to 1).
      Regression(double[] xxData, double[] yData, double[] weight)
      Constructor with data with x as 1D array and weights provided.

    • Method Detail

      • setMaximumNumberOfInterationsForNelderAndMeadSimplex

        public void setMaximumNumberOfInterationsForNelderAndMeadSimplex(int n)
        Sets the maximum number of iterations in the estimation of Nelder and Mead simplex. Default value is 3000, which could slowdown massive calculations.
        Parameters:
        n - The new value.

      • getBestEstimates

        public double[] getBestEstimates()
        Get the best estimates of the unknown parameters.
        Returns:
        The best estimates.

      • getBestEstimatesErrors

        public double[] getBestEstimatesErrors()
        Get the best estimates of the errors in the unknown parameters.
        Returns:
        The best estimates of the errors.

      • getRMS

        public double getRMS()
        Returns the rms of the fit.
        Returns:
        The sum of the squares of the differences between the fitting value and the input value divided by the weight applied to each point.

      • customFunction

        public ChartSeriesElement customFunction(java.lang.String function,
                                double[] initialValues)
                                  throws JPARSECException
        Fits the input data to a custom function f=f(x). The unknown parameters must be named p1, p2, p3, ... Convergency is not guarranteed, even in case convergence() return true.
        Parameters:
        function - The function in Java notation.
        initialValues - initial estimates of the unknown parameters. The values should be as close as possible to the correct fitting, specially in the relative signs of the parameters.
        Returns:
        A series object representing the data and the fitting, for charting purposes.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • gaussian

        public void gaussian()
              throws JPARSECException
        Fits the input data to a Gaussian.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • gaussian

        public void gaussian(double[] initialEstimates,
            boolean[] fixed)
              throws JPARSECException
        Fits data to a Gaussian (normal) probability function with option to fix some of the parameters. Pparameter order is mean, sd, and yscale in the function: (yscale/sd.sqrt(2.pi)).exp(-0.5[(x - xmean)/sd]^2).
        Parameters:
        initialEstimates - Initial estimates of the three mentioned values.
        fixed - True or false to fix each of them.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • linearGeneral

        public void linearGeneral()
                   throws JPARSECException
        Generalised linear regression y = a.f1(x) + b.f2(x) + c.f3(x) + . . . for a set of x input arrays.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • linear

        public void linear()
            throws JPARSECException
        Multiple linear regression with intercept (including y = ax + b) y = a + b.x1 + c.x2 + d.x3 + . . .
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • polynomial

        public ChartSeriesElement polynomial(int deg)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Polynomial fitting y = a + b.x + c.x^2 + d.x^3 + . . .
        Parameters:
        deg - The degree of the polynomial.
        Returns:
        A series object representing the data and the fitting, for charting purposes.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • polynomial

        public ChartSeriesElement polynomial(int deg,
                            double fixed_a)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Polynomial fitting y = a + b.x + c.x^2 + d.x^3 + . . . where a is fixed.
        Parameters:
        deg - Degree of the polynomial.
        fixed_a - The value of a.
        Returns:
        A series object representing the data and the fitting, for charting purposes.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • convergence

        public boolean convergence()
        Returns true if the convergence was reached, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True or false.
